thread.title: Finance Minister: Cong MLAs praise CM and finance minister for Budget | Jaipur News - Times of India
thread.title_full: Finance Minister: Cong MLAs praise CM and finance minister for Budget | Jaipur News - Times of India

author: TNN
title: Finance Minister: Cong MLAs praise CM and finance minister for Budget | Jaipur News - Times of India
text: Jaipur: Congress MLAs Bheem Raj Bhati and Shikha Meel Barala on Thursday praised the various projects announced for their constituencies in the state Budget, and expressed gratitude to chief minister Bhajan Lal Sharma and finance minister Diya Kumari. Bhati thanked the CM and the finance minister for the development projects announced for his constituency, Pali. He said, “I salute both Diya Kumari ji and the CM. I salute her because despite being a woman and hailing from a wealthy family, she presented such a Budget. I salute the CM for appointing her as the finance minister.” Barala praised the finance minister for announcing pink bio-toilets for women in the Budget, increasing mess allowances in govt sports hostels, and proposals for the civil aviation sector. She welcomed the decision to allocate Rs 7 crore for building five main roads in her constituency, Chomu.An argument ensued between the leader of Opposition, Tikaram Jully, and BJP MLA Srichand Kriplani when the former in jest termed the BJP MLAs as 'Bhajan Mandali'. When Kriplani opposed it, Jully said the CM was the leader of the House, and therefore, BJP MLAs were a part of 'Bhajan mandali'. tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyTOI interview: One budget, opportunities for all, says Rajasthan finance minister Diya KumariLearn about Rajasthan's ambitious budget goals outlined by finance minister Diya Kumari. The budget aims to boost the economy to $350 billion, improve infrastructure, and attract industries. Key focuses include ease of doing business, supporting local industries, and addressing water and electricity issues.111649736Union Budget: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman to present Budget 2024-25 in Lok Sabha on July 23Get the latest updates on the upcoming Budget Session of Parliament scheduled from July 22 to August 12. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget for the fiscal year 2024-25 on July 23. President Droupadi Murmu approved the summoning of both Houses of Parliament.111536224Finance ministry wraps up pre-Budget consultationsFinance ministry wraps up pre-Budget consultations with FM Nirmala Sitharaman and team meeting representatives from 10 sectors. Participants praise detailed discussions and opportunity to share views on government policies.111560268
